tool_input.new_string:
import React, { useEffect, useState } from 'react'
import Link from 'next/link'
import { motion, useAnimation, useInView } from 'framer-motion'
import { useIntersectionObserver } from 'react-intersection-observer'
import { 
  CheckIcon,
  ArrowRightIcon,
  SparklesIcon,
  CodeBracketIcon,
  ShieldCheckIcon,
  CpuChipIcon,
  CommandLineIcon,
  StarIcon,
  PlayIcon
} from '@heroicons/react/24/outline'
import Button from '@/components/ui/Button'
import Card from '@/components/ui/Card'
import ProductTour from '@/components/demo/ProductTour'

tool_input.old_string:
<Link href="/demo">
              <motion.div
                whileHover={{ scale: 1.05 }}
                whileTap={{ scale: 0.95 }}
              >
                <Button 
                  variant="outline" 
                  size="lg" 
                  className="w-full sm:w-auto border-slate-600 text-slate-300 hover:bg-slate-800/50 hover:border-slate-500 px-8 py-4 text-lg backdrop-blur-sm"
                >
                  Watch Demo
                </Button>
              </motion.div>
            </Link>
tool_input.new_string:
<motion.div
              whileHover={{ scale: 1.05 }}
              whileTap={{ scale: 0.95 }}
            >
              <Button 
                variant="outline" 
                size="lg" 
                className="w-full sm:w-auto border-slate-600 text-slate-300 hover:bg-slate-800/50 hover:border-slate-500 px-8 py-4 text-lg backdrop-blur-sm"
                onClick={() => setShowTour(true)}
              >
                <PlayIcon className="w-5 h-5 mr-2" />
                Watch Demo
              </Button>
            </motion.div>

tool_input.description: Verify production health status
tool_input.prompt:
The user reports that a production incident has been resolved and all critical services are healthy. Please verify the current system status and confirm that it's safe to resume development work on the EAI - MCP Codex frontend project.

Check:
1. Current system health and stability
2. Any residual issues that might affect development
3. Whether all services are properly operational
4. If there are any ongoing monitoring alerts
5. Confirmation that development can safely proceed

Provide a brief status report and give the all-clear for continuing frontend development work.

todos.content: Verify all critical services are healthy and operational
Check for any active monitoring alerts or warnings
Confirm system stability for safe development resumption
Assess EAI MCP Codex frontend project current state

tool_input.description: Check current location and project structure
Check for running Next.js/Node processes
Check what services are running on key development ports
Check what services are running on key development ports using ss command
Check if frontend service on port 3000 is responding
Check if backend API service on port 8000 is responding
Check Docker container status for system services
Check for any unhealthy or stopped containers

tool_input.command: curl -s http://localhost:3002/api/health | jq . 2>/dev/null || curl -s http://localhost:3002/api/health || echo "Frontend health check failed"
tool_input.description: Check frontend API health endpoint

tool_input.command: curl -s http://localhost:3001/api/health | jq . 2>/dev/null || curl -s http://localhost:3001/api/health || echo "Staff frontend health check failed"
tool_input.description: Check staff frontend API health endpoint
Check backend API health status
Check recent logs from frontend container
Check recent logs from staff frontend container

todos.content: Verify all critical services are healthy and operational
Check for any active monitoring alerts or warnings

tool_input.description: Critical CSS loading failure - immediate resolution
tool_input.prompt:
🚨 CRITICAL PRODUCTION INCIDENT - CSS Not Loading

USER REPORTS:
- CSS not loading on direct access: http://192.168.2.185:3000
- CSS not loading through domain: https://new.ethical-ai-insider.com

This is a critical frontend failure affecting the launch-ready redesign. Users cannot see the completed conversion-optimized design.

IMMEDIATE ACTIONS REQUIRED:
1. Check frontend container status and logs
2. Verify Next.js build process and static asset generation
3. Examine CSS file paths and serving
4. Test nginx proxy configuration for static assets
5. Identify root cause of CSS loading failure
6. Implement immediate fix to restore proper frontend display

This is blocking all user access to the completed frontend work. Treat as P0 incident requiring immediate resolution.

Current working directory: /opt/Tmux-Orchestrator/llm-stack/rag-agent

Please investigate and fix the CSS loading issue immediately.

todos.content: Check frontend container status and logs for errors
Verify Next.js build process and static asset generation
Examine CSS file paths and serving configuration
Test nginx proxy configuration for static assets
Implement immediate fix to restore CSS loading

tool_input.command: cd /opt/Tmux-Orchestrator/llm-stack/rag-agent && docker compose ps | grep frontend

Try build again after fixing permissions
Start dev server on port 3000 to restore CSS

Check what's using the target ports
Check port usage with netstat
Check port usage with ss command
Start Next.js dev server on port 3333
Test if frontend is responding with CSS
Check if mcp network exists

tool_input.description: Start temporary frontend container on mcp network

tool_input.description: Start frontend container with internal networking only
Check frontend container startup logs

  frontend:
    environment:
      - NODE_ENV=development
      - NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL=http://model-router:8001

      - NODE_ENV=development

    command: npm run dev
    ports:
      - "3002:3000"
